m_szDocSumamry: Natural Gas Overtakes Nuclear as Environmentally Friendly Fuel for Utilities July 8th, 2011 by Glenn Meyers   NATURAL GAS OVERTAKES WIND AND NUCLEAR AS THE TOP “ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY” TECHNOLOGY – BUT UTILITY EXECS STILL PREFER NUCLEAR A recent Black & Veatch survey of utilities concerning their fuels of choice shows that natural gas has overtaken nuclear as the preferred environmentally friendly fuel.’ The rise for natural gas represents a significant change from previous years dating to 2006, where nuclear energy has ranked in the top spot.
